values:
It's 3:00 in the morning and I'm sitting here researching depression.  The truth is, I'm afraid.  I'm afraid that if I don't get help I'm going to die and I'll never have known true happiness.  I'm not saying I haven't been happy.  Some days with Collin, with my family, and with Jenn have been memorable BECAUSE of how happy they made me.  I've been happy a lot in my life.  And I feel lucky for each moment I feel that way.  But the truth is, I've never had happiness IN my life.  I've never experiences the feeling of happiness that lasts more than a day or a week.  To me, happiness is when you can go to bed without worrying about how you're gonna feel tomorrow.  Happiness is when you can look at your reflection in the mirror and not think about how much you want to be happy.

I need help.  I think I'll make an appointment with JoEllen tomorrow.

It's pretty hard to forgive someone when they never ask for your forgiveness.  Religion tells us that forgiveness gets you into heaven.  All you have to do is confess your sins and God forgives you.  And if there is no confession, you just go to hell.  Why shouldn't that be the same on earth as well?  Forgive those who ask, forget those who don't.  

Sometimes I forget I even have a father.  He's merely existed in this world for years now.  At least when he hit us or yelled at us we knew we got to him somehow.  Now, I don't think anything gets to him.  Mom says she's happy, but no one can be happy in the house of misery.  I was just the only one who bled from it.
